remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ItemDrag> event occurs when the user begins dragging an item. An ItemDragEventArgs object specifies which mouse button was pressed.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of ItemDragEventArgs when enabling drag-and-drop operations within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ItemDragEventArgs.Button%2A> property determines whether the dragged node should be moved or copied to its destination. The node, represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ItemDragEventArgs.Item%2A> property, is then passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop%2A> method along with a value indicating the desired effect.
For the complete example, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.ItemDrag?displayProperty=fullName> reference topic.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property enables you to determine which mouse buttons were pressed during a drag-and-drop operation. The value of this property can be used to properly determine how the drag-and drop-operation should be performed. For example, you might want to move an item to a new location when the left mouse button is pressed, and copy it to the new location when the right mouse button is pressed.
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ItemDragEventArgs> class when you enable drag-and-drop operations within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> control. The Button property determines whether the dragged node should be moved or copied to its destination. The node, represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ItemDragEventArgs.Item%2A> property, is then passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop%2A> method, along with a value that indicates the desired effect of the drag-and-drop operation.
For the complete example, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.ItemDrag?displayProperty=fullName> reference topic.
